description: From Middle English envious, from Anglo-Norman envious, from Old French envieus, envious (modern French envieux), from Latin invidiōsus; more at envy. Doublet of invidious, borrowed directly from Latin. Displaced native Old English æfestiġ.

adjectives.description: envious (comparative more envious, superlative most envious)

entries.meaning: Feeling or exhibiting envy; jealously desiring the excellence or good fortune of another; maliciously grudging
examples: an envious man, disposition, or attack; envious tongues
